topics.overview: In computing, traceroute and tracert are computer network diagnostic commands for displaying the route and measuring transit delays of packets across an Internet Protocol network.
topics.name: Tracert

modules.overview: In computing, `traceroute` and `tracert` are computer network diagnostic commands for displaying the route (path) and measuring transit delays of packets across an Internet Protocol (IP) network.
modules.name: Introduction

topics.overview: A computer network is a digital telecommunications network which allows nodes to share resources.
topics.name: Networking

modules.overview: User Datagram Protocol (UDP) is connectionless and not as reliable a service as TCP. There is no acknowledgement of packet delivery, sequencing or even error recovery.
modules.name: UDP

questions.answer: A unique identifier assigned to a Network Interface Controller (NIC).

modules.overview: A Media Access Control (MAC) address of a device is a unique identifier assigned to a Network Interface Controller (NIC).
modules.name: MAC Address

modules.overview: The internet, as a collection of worldwide networks, requires policies, procedures, standards and protocols to make it work.
modules.name: Standards and Organisations

modules.overview: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) is connection-orientated.
modules.name: TCP

modules.overview: Models are used in networking as a representational and simplified way to give us a high-level understanding of the processes that are happening within a network.
modules.name: Models

topics.overview: In computing, netstat (network statistics) is a command-line network utility that displays network connections for Transmission Control Protocol (both incoming and outgoing), routing tables and network protocol statistics, and uses a number of network interfaces (network interface controller or software-defined network interface).
topics.name: Netstat

modules.overview: The netstat tool is very important for Linux network administrators, as well as system administrators, to monitor and troubleshoot their network related problems and determine network traffic performance.
modules.name: Basic Usage for Linux

modules.overview: Netstat on Windows displays active TCP connections, ports on which the computer is listening, Ethernet statistics, the IP routing table, IPv4 statistics (for the IP, ICMP, TCP, and UDP protocols), and IPv6 statistics (for the IPv6, ICMPv6, TCP over IPv6, and UDP over IPv6 protocols).
modules.name: Basic Usage for Windows

questions.value: What is the Netstat command used for?
questions.answer: Displaying network connections for Transmission Control Protocol, routing tables, and a number of network interface and network protocol statistics
choices: Provide information about the currently running processes, including their process identification numbers (PIDs)
Allowing you to run programs with the security privileges of another user

topics.overview: netcat (often abbreviated to nc) is a computer networking utility for reading from and writing to network connections using TCP or UDP.
topics.name: netcat

questions.value: What can port scanning be used for?
questions.answer: Finding out what ports are available on a host.
choices: Monitoring TCP traffic going through the given ports.

modules.overview: Port scanning is a technique used for finding out which ports have an application running on them, making them accessible.
modules.name: Port Scanning with netcat

topics.overview: Markdown is a way to write content for the web. It's written in what people call 'plaintext'; this is just the regular alphabet, with a few symbols (such as `*` and `#`).
topics.name: Markdown

modules.overview: This module explains how to integrate links and images into your Markdown files. Links and images make your Markdown more interactive and interesting, so it's really useful to learn how to use them.
modules.name: Links and Images

modules.overview: This topic will go over some of the more advanced Markdown syntax and formatting. There's lots you can do with Markdown, so experiment beyond this brief introduction to it!
modules.name: Advanced

topics.overview: Jenkins is a self-contained, open source automation server that can be used to automate all sorts of tasks related to building, testing, and delivering or deploying software.
topics.name: Jenkins

modules.overview: Freestyle projects in Jenkins are a type of job you can create for almost any automated task.
modules.name: Freestyle Project

modules.overview: A Jenkins project (job) is a repeatable build job, which contains steps and post-build actions.
modules.name: Jobs

modules.overview: Basic deployment of a Python Flask server, using systemd and a Freestyle Project.
modules.name: Basic Python Flask Freestyle Project Deployment with systemd

modules.overview: This document aims to guide you through the setup process of Jenkins, through the graphical (web) interface.
modules.name: Installation Wizard

topics.overview: The Linux open-source operating system, or Linux OS, is a freely distributable, cross-platform operating system, based on Unix. It can be installed on PCs, laptops, netbooks, mobile and tablet devices, video game consoles, servers, supercomputers and more.
topics.name: Linux

modules.overview: The sudo tool allows a user to act as a superuser for a command.
modules.name: Sudoers

modules.overview: A service, or daemon, is a background application that waits to be used, or carries out essential tasks, rather than being in direct control of an interactive user.
modules.name: Managing systemd Services

topics.overview: PowerShell is a task-based command-line shell and scripting language built on .NET.
topics.name: PowerShell

modules.overview: Conditional statements in PowerShell enable scripts to make decisions based on provided conditions.
modules.name: Conditional Statements

modules.overview: Arrays and iteration can be used in PowerShell for solving extensive, repetitive, procedural tasks.
modules.name: Loops and Iteration

modules.overview: PowerShell operators play an important role in PowerShell scripting. Learning to use operators is essential if you want to take your scripting to the next level.
modules.name: Comparison and Logical Operators

modules.overview: PowerShell has the ability to set and access system environment variables.
modules.name: Environment Variables

modules.overview: Variables are a programming concept that has remained consistent across many different programming languages and PowerShell isn’t an exception; a variable is like a container that holds information.
modules.name: Variables

modules.overview: Knowing how to navigate a file system with PowerShell, Command Prompt or Bash is important for being able to automate tasks with their respective scripting languages.
modules.name: Navigation

modules.overview: Arrays hold a list of data, and in PowerShell, they don't even need to be the same type of data.
modules.name: Arrays

modules.overview: PowerShell is a tool that allows us to manage machines from the command-line, as well as create scripts to automate tasks on Windows, Linux and MacOS operating systems.
modules.name: Introduction

modules.overview: In this module you will learn what technologies allow cloud services to work.
modules.name: Cloud Enabling Technologies

modules.overview: In this module, you will learn about the benefits that are presented through cloud technologies.
modules.name: Cloud Benefits

modules.overview: In this module you will learn about the concepts of cloud. These concepts are shared among all the cloud providers.
modules.name: Cloud Concepts

topics.overview: Iptables is a command line utility for configuring Linux kernel firewall.
topics.name: Iptables

modules.overview: Iptables is a command line utility for configuring Linux kernel firewall.
modules.name: Introduction

topics.overview: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 165 fully featured services from data centers globally. Millions of customers —including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—trust AWS to power their infrastructure, become more agile, and lower costs.
topics.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)

modules.overview: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.
modules.name: Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)

modules.overview: An EC2 instance is a virtual server in Amazon’s Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) for running applications on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure.
modules.name: AWS EC2 Instances

modules.overview: A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your instance to control inbound and outbound traffic.
modules.name: EC2 VPC Security Groups

modules.overview: A route table contains a set of rules, called routes, that are used to determine where network traffic is directed.
modules.name: AWS Route Tables

modules.overview: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) is a web service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It is designed to make web-scale cloud computing easier for developers.
modules.name: Elastic Cloud Compute (EC2)

modules.overview: An internet gateway is a horizontally scaled, redundant, and highly available VPC component that allows communication between instances in your VPC and the internet.
modules.name: EC2 VPC Internet Gateways

modules.overview: This document aims to cover the basics of the Groovy programming language's syntax.
modules.name: Syntax

modules.overview: A closure in Groovy is an open, anonymous, block of code that can take arguments, return a value and be assigned to a variable.  A closure may reference variables declared in its surrounding scope.  In opposition to the formal definition of a closure, a closure in the Groovy language can also contain free variables that are defined outside of its surrounding scope.
modules.name: Closures

modules.overview: Variables are of course very commonly used, across all programming languages.
modules.name: Variables

topics.overview: Nginx is a web server which can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache.
topics.name: NGINX

modules.overview: NGINX uses a text-based configuration file written in a specific format.
modules.name: Configuration

modules.overview: NGINX can be configured as a web server to serve content such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Images.
modules.name: Web Server Configuration

modules.overview: An NGINX reverse proxy server sits in front of web servers and forwards client requests (e.g. web browsers) to those web servers.
modules.name: HTTP Reverse Proxy Configuration

modules.overview: Nginx is a web server which can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache.
modules.name: Introduction
